TopicTitle: KSP'ers new and old, come say hello :D

Articles.Content:
Yet another survivor of the Great April Derp of 2013 posts! I think I may have lost my post count, but ehh. It's at least good that the forum is back.

Also, I can't access this forum on Firefox, so using Chrome.

Well, thats great! I was ashamed of my low post count. oh, wait... AGHHHHHH!!!

and also, what caused this mass data loss?

Congratulations to all survivors! I hope that this tragic event does not occur again!

As to what happened, read this article: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/content.php/161-KSP-Forums-and-SpacePort-are-back-up-Important-Notice-for-Forum-Members

It has as much info as Squad has/is willing to share about recent events. Tip: look at the right side of the main forum page for articles and blog posts from the devs

Well, I lost all my posts, but my account is still here

I'm so glad that my old threads are deleted. Oh, it was so embarrassing...

Howdi - This is a great game for me - gets my creativity stuff goin on.

I am glad things with the forum and site got sorted out.

I miss losing my post count AKA MrZeta AKA

But the game goes on...

PS: DOnt forget I am streaming live almost every nite - I cant get enough of this game !

http://www.twitch.tv/cdr_zeta

In fact I am streaming tonite off and on...working on a rescue plane, rovers, some gorund ops...cant go to space without good safety and rescue procedures for the lil fella's - and gal Kerbals if there are any !

Cdr Zeta

Hello!

I'd also like to ask one thing: I had a thread called "A newbie how-to, read this!" it was stickyed too. Does anyone have something like a google cache for it? Fact: As the forums crashed, I bought a new PC, so I didn't have a chance to do it myself.
I lost all of my posts... But my account still works. And it still has all the modifications I made to it!
I have my account, post are gone though Don't have even rights to boast with signature :/ Still better than exploding rockets. Oh, and hello again everyone

Got my account wiped, too. That's a tad of a downer.

Still, it's a shot at a fresh start. Glad to see the forums back!
Hello People, I just signed up before everything crashed, so I didn't lose anything. I would like to pick an avatar.
I lost my post count and established member thingy and I presume the "Curious George" thing is to do with my post count being reset
I lost my account but thats fine. Hi guys! I hope you all are fine and productive in KSP!
HeyHey, There and back again anyway an avatar would be nice yes.

Still alive. However, lost my newer avatar (I still have it on my computer)

Edited April 23, 2013 by Bioman222
Hi. New on the forums but have played a bit of Kerbal by now, just hadn't gotten around to posting here.

Hey, new to the forum. Just wanted to say hi (and help get my post count to five so I can get a custom avatar, mwaha..). If you ever wanna discus something KSP with a stranger for no particular reason, send me a PM! Love the game now, and excited for where it's headed.

p.s. best. emoticons. EVER.

I just started yesterday and so far have just dumped time into it. Really excited to delve into this further. So far I have got a couple ships into orbit and have made a crazy number of failed ships too. Sorry to hear about the wiping of accounts!
At least my images are still all there on imagur. I get to use them all afresh!
Ive been playing Kerbal for months, but my first visit to the forums.

I also lost my account in the Great Forum Purge of April 2013. No biggie though.

Having way too fun with this game. It must be illegal in some way...

~ Taranis Elsu

Edited April 24, 2013 by TaranisElsu
added signature
I lost my account too but I'm back!
I was desperate for the forums to come back on, and then we got the memory corruption. But it's still great to see you guys tried your hardest to recover any data!

Hello hello! I'm brand-spanking new around here and absolutely loving KSP. A week or so ago, an old online friend was broadcasting via twitch.tv. So while waiting for a Battlefield 3 battle to end on 21CW, I tuned in to his broadcast and saw that he was building a rocket of some sort. I messaged him asking what the heck he was doing and he informed me about KSP. After downloading the demo, I was forever hooked! I bought the full version that night and couldn't be happier!

Thanks to the dev team and all the people that support them and the game. I can't wait to virtually live out my childhood dreams and discover new ones.

~Dantes
It's good to be back. Lost my account but haven't lost my mind! Same name, same game. It all works out!
Hey, I got KSP a few months ago but haven't had a chance to join the forum until today. So hello everyone!
